title: Neil Woodford's eponymous business will go the same way as his failed fund
text:
I’ve always wondered what people meant when they were shocked, but not surprised. How is it possible to be shocked by something that isn’t surprising?

Yet this is what I felt amid the news the Woodford Equity Income fund is to be wound up. I was shocked, because I never thought we would get to this stage, but not surprised, because it was the only sensible solution left.

Woodford investors have lost far too much. They will potentially lose more as the fund is turned into cash. But they would have probably have been in an even worse position had Neil Woodford continued his farcical attempt of switching the fund's assets from illiquid to large and easily-tradeable companies.

Investors will likely...
description: I’ve always wondered what people meant when they were shocked, but not surprised.
